clinical_study.brief_title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Lactibiane Tolerance
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Lactibiane Tolerance on Symptoms Severity of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of a probiotic combination (Lactibiane Tolerance) on the severity of symptoms in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of a probiotic combination (Lactibiane Tolerance) on the severity of symptoms in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
The secondary purposes are to evaluate the effects of the intervention on:
- quality of life
- severity of fatigue, anxiety and depression
- levels of inflammatory markers in blood and tools

primary_outcome.measure: Severity of bowel symptoms according to the Francis Score
primary_outcome.description: The severity of bowel symptoms is evaluated with a quality of life questionnaire, the Francis Score before and after 6 weeks of complementation in placebo and verum groups.

secondary_outcome.description: Effect of the intervention on transit and abdominal pain
The level of anxiety/depression will be measured with the HAD scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the complementation on fatigue
secondary_outcome.description: The level of fatigue will be measured with the score to the fatigue Impact Scale (FIS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the intervention on immunological parameters in stools
secondary_outcome.description: The effects of the intervention on immunological parameters in stools will be evaluated via the levels of beta-defensine 2 and sérine protease activities

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of the intervention on immunological parameters in blood
secondary_outcome.description: The impact of the intervention on immunological parameters in blood will be measured with levels of endotoxines, ultrasensitive protein C Reactive and cytokines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Irritable bowel syndrome according to the Rome II criteria
- 150< Francis Score < 300
- HAD score inferior or egal to 25
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hypersensitivity to one of the composant of the product
- Use of probiotics or antibiotics last four weeks
- use of prohibited drugs
- bowel preparation for morphological examination last month
- pregnancy or lactation
- immundepressed or co-existing other serious illness or evolutive
